t0.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 7 days from today.

t1.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 7 days after t0.

timespan.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 7 days. The default is 2 hours.

resolution.description: The time resolution in seconds for returned data. The valid resolutions are: 60, 300, 3600, 86400. The default is 300.

$ul: **endTs**: The end time of the query range
**lanGoodput**: LAN goodput (Number of useful information bits delivered over a LAN per unit of time)
**responseDuration**: Duration of the response, in milliseconds
**startTs**: The start time of the query range
**wanGoodput**: WAN goodput (Number of useful information bits delivered over a WAN per unit of time)
